answers.answer:
Refugees from Ukraine in Romania are eligible for dental services, with those aged 0-18 receiving 100% coverage. For those over 18, coverage ranges from 60% to 100%, with 100% coverage extended to 18-26 year olds who are students or apprentices and do not earn income, or individuals under special legal conditions.

To find detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dentist and refer to the section titled "Dentistry for refugees from Ukraine in Romania" or the "Guide on the rights of people from the armed conflict zone in Ukraine in the social health insurance system".

For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/dentist

answers.answer:
The basic dental medical package for refugees in Romania includes consultation, treatment of simple caries, treatment of oral mucosa conditions, dental extractions, alveolar curettage and treatment of hemorrhage, and decapsulation. It also covers removable acrylic prosthesis on the arch, physiognomic or semi-physiognomic prosthetic elements, and devices used in the treatment of congenital malformations.

To find this detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dentist and read under the section "Dentistry for refugees from Ukraine in Romania".

For Ukrainian refugees over 18 years old in Romania, dental service fees are covered at a percentage varying between 60% and 100%, depending on the type of service. However, for those aged 18-26 who are students, apprentices, or not earning income from work, and for people benefiting from special conditions, 100% of the fees for some services are covered.

To find detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dentist and read under the section titled "Dentistry for refugees from Ukraine in Romania".

answers.answer:
Young adult Ukrainian refugees (18-26 years old) receive 100% dental coverage in Romania if they are students (including high school graduates until the start of the academic year, but not more than 3 months), apprentices, or students, and do not earn income from work.

You can find this detailed information on the dopomoha.ro website by visiting https://dopomoha.ro/en/dentist and reading the section titled "Dentistry for refugees from Ukraine in Romania."
